item.title: Rug Racers: Ultimate
item.description: “Rug Racers: Ultimate” is an arcade flying-carpet racing game where you race against your friend on a physical carpet. I was the lead programmer responsible for making the engine, the input system and a lot of the gameplay code, and I also did a lot of game design. We were a 6-person team and made the game during a 10 week long school course. We won 2 awards at Gotland Game Conference, as well as got nominated at Swedish Game Awards!

item.title: Mortal Shell
item.description: Through a game-jam friend, I got the opportunity to work on “Mortal Shell” as a gameplay programmer and designer. It’s a soulslike action-RPG set in a shattered world where your skill and resilience is tested. Since release, the game has sold over 500 000 copies worldwide, and received a metacritic score of 76.

item.title: 3D mesh boolean experiments
item.description: I used to create 3D art a lot, and doing it has given me lots of ideas for a new kind of creation tool. It’s just begging to be made.

item.title: Building a compiler from scratch
item.description: One day I got annoyed at all the problems of C++ and the fact that there weren’t any good alternatives to it, and I decided to see if I could do something about it. I knew it would be difficult to make my own language, but I wasn’t entirely sure why: parsing code is easy, so why should making a low-level language be? Off I went, diving into the world of compilers to see how far I’d get.

item.title: Bonus 2: Rocket League mods
item.description: Rocket League is the best, no one can deny that. But what if you could also play volleyball in it? I made that possible! (among with other mods)

item.title: Bonus: Art portfolio
item.description: I’ve always liked art. I went to an art high school and was doing a lot of 3D art at the time. I learned about composition, lighting, 3D techniques and how to work with programs like Blender, Substance Painter & Designer, Zbrush and Unreal. I was on my way to becoming a game artist! Then I got really hooked with programming and it has become my main focus. I still take a lot of the knowledge with me to my programming projects.
